bibl.title: Stray Notes on Roman Names in Greek Documents. Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.note: Three notes on the interpretation of some Roman name forms in Greek documents. The third note concerns the possible connection of Roman names including both the praenomen Marcus and the gentilicum Aurelius (Marci Aurelii) not only with grants of citizenship under Marcus Aurelius and Commodus but also with the Constitutio Antoniniana as re-asserted against some recent views and supported with further evidence from Greek documents (e.g. P. Oxy. LVIII, 3920).

bibl.title: Roman Onomastics in the Greek East: Social and Political Aspects. Proceedings of the International Colloquium Organized by the Finnish Institute and the Centre for Greek and Roman Antiquity, Athens, 7-9 September 1993

bibl.seg: 145.4 P. Giss. I, 40 P. Oxy. LVIII, 3920
BURASELIS Kostas, Stray Notes on Roman Names in Greek Documents. Avec résumé en anglais.

Athanasios D. RIZAKIS (Ed.), Roman Onomastics in the Greek East: Social and Political Aspects. Proceedings of the International Colloquium Organized by the Finnish Institute and the Centre for Greek and Roman Antiquity, Athens, 7-9 September 1993 = Μελετήματα. 21 (Athens - Paris, 1996) pp. 55-63, 19 figg.

Three notes on the interpretation of some Roman name forms in Greek documents. The third note concerns the possible connection of Roman names including both the praenomen Marcus and the gentilicum Aurelius (Marci Aurelii) not only with grants of citizenship under Marcus Aurelius and Commodus but also with the Constitutio Antoniniana as re-asserted against some recent views and supported with further evidence from Greek documents (e.g. P. Oxy. LVIII, 3920).
